longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
minidescription: liven up a web page with CSS animations
description: You've joined Ohmyfood as a junior developer. Ohmyfood is a young startup that wants to make its mark on the restaurant market. Already present in New York, it now wants to make its mark in Paris. Your mission is to develop a mobile-first site listing the menus of gourmet restaurants. In addition to traditional reservation systems, customers will be able to compose their meal menu so that dishes are ready when they arrive. No more waiting in restaurants!

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
minidescription: liven up a web page with javascript
description: You work as a front-end developer for the ArchiWebos agency, which has 50 employees. Having completed your last project a little ahead of schedule, you are sent to reinforce a team working on the design of an interior designer's portfolio site. It's Monday morning and time for your first team briefing on this project. You know you're going to receive a lot of information, so you're getting ready to take notes.

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
minidescription: Developp a web app with React
description: Kasa is recruiting you as a freelance front-end developer to develop its new web platform. Kasa has been in the apartment rental business for almost 10 years now. With more than 500 ads posted every day, Kasa is one of the leading apartment rental companies in France. The perfect opportunity for you to add a great reference to your freelance portfolio! The Kasa site was coded over 10 years ago in ASP.NET, with a significant amount of legacy code. So Laura, the CTO, launched a complete overhaul to switch to a full JavaScript stack with NodeJS on the back-end, and React on the front-end. Kasa also took the opportunity to commission new mock-ups from its regular freelance designer. A big project for this year!

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
description: You're a freelance developer and you've decided to offer your SEO services to new customers. To do so, you've analyzed several websites. You then contacted the administrators of the sites that could be optimized to offer them your services. Among your prospects is the website of Nina Carducci, a photographer one of your friends told you about. Here's the e-mail you sent to Nina: Hello, I'm a web developer and I'm writing to you because I had a chance to have a look at your site. I find your work great quality. However, I found your site to be relatively slow to load, and I think you could gain a lot of visitors if your site were optimized for search engines.

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
description: You're a freelance front-end developer, and the events agency 724events has contacted you for an assignment. The agency wants to publish the new version of its showcase site. This is a one-page site. The design has been validated, and a first freelance developer began integration a few weeks ago. Unfortunately, this freelancer had to abandon the project for personal reasons. The site is functional, but a few bugs are preventing visitors from using it properly. So 724events calls on you to finalize the work. You meet Jean-Baptiste, the agency's Marketing Director, by videoconference, so that he can give you a more detailed presentation of the project. The mission represents an interesting challenge, so you decide to accept! Delighted, Jean-Baptiste quickly sends you an e-mail with all the information you need to get started.

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
minidescription: Implementing Redux in a React app
description: You've just joined Argent Bank as a front-end developer. Argent Bank is a new online bank looking to break into the banking sector. You're working with Mila, the project manager, to set up the user dashboard. You receive two emails from the CTO, Avery Moreau: Hello Mila and team, We're about to start work on our React web application for the new user authentication system. With tight deadlines, we're relying heavily on the team! Here's an overview of what we need for phase 1: User authentication. Create the complete responsive web application with React. Use Redux to manage the state of the entire application. For phase 2: Transactions, we're still in the design phase.
theconqueredpowersofforce: Create a responsive web app with React
use swagger editor to edit possible API endpoints

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
description: former accountant and now front-end developer. I wasn't going to leave without an application that could help my former colleagues and, more broadly, all French accountants. This application was conceived because I systematically encountered the same problems when I was an accountant. Indeed, the roots of the subsidiary accounts kept at the customer's premises were different from the accounting roots kept by the accounting firm. We couldn't simply integrate the FEC as it was, otherwise the continuity of the chart of accounts from one year to the next would not have been respected for the accounting firm. So we had to modify the roots of the subsidiary accounts. I always did this via Excel, but each time it took between 5 and 10 minutes. That may not sound like much, but when you have a large volume of FEC to integrate, it's a lot of work, especially during the tax period, when every minute counts. Now, with this application, it's done in 30 seconds. Thanks to all!
theconqueredpowersofforce: Create a responsive web app with React

longtimeago: A long time ago, in a galaxy far,
description: Hi everyone, I've made a site where you can consult information on all the countries in the world. You can filter by region of the world: Oceania, Europe, etc... .You can also search for the country you're interested in using the search bar. Click on the country you want to learn more about. A Google map is displayed to give you an idea of the country's location on the world map. Border countries are also displayed, and you can click on them to find out more.
